abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether the current device supports this session configuration class.
overview:
## Discussion

Different types of AR experiences (which you configure using concrete [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARConfiguration] subclasses) can have different hardware requirements.

Before attempting to create an AR configuration, verify that the user’s device supports the configuration you plan to use by checking the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARConfiguration/isSupported] property of the corresponding configuration class. If this property’s value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], the current device does not support the requested configuration.

# isSupported

**Type Property**

A Boolean value indicating whether the current device supports this session configuration class.

## Declaration

```swift
class var isSupported: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

Different types of AR experiences (which you configure using concrete [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARConfiguration] subclasses) can have different hardware requirements.

Before attempting to create an AR configuration, verify that the user’s device supports the configuration you plan to use by checking the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARConfiguration/isSupported] property of the corresponding configuration class. If this property’s value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], the current device does not support the requested configuration.
title: isSupported
